{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pressor escape in SIADH is characterized by a sudden decrease in urine volume with an increase in urine osmolality independent of circulating vasopressin levels. This means that despite high levels of vasopressin, the kidneys are able to escape its antidiuretic effects and excrete more water, leading to a decrease in urine volume and an increase in urine osmolality.", "answer_choice": "C"}
